para.emphasis: How can a web page or document be associated with a resource?

sect2.title: Context
sect2.para: There is often a need to associate a resource with a page or document that provides further, human-readable content about the resource. For example a travel site may publish a travellers guide to Paris. This information may often be present in a content management system or dataset as "further reading" links. In the absence of Linked Data for the target resource, how can these extra relations be published as RDF?

sect2.title: Solution
sect2.para: Use the foaf:topic and/or foaf:primaryTopic relationships to associate a resource with a page(s) in which it is featured or discussed
